When the project finished, she took out a loan in order to continue working.  Silveria has the chicken farm at her home and all the family helps with it, as much care is required with the chickens.  Beforehand, Silveria only worked in agriculture but now, while her husband works the land, Silveria looks after the chickens.

Silveria is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to buy more chickens.  Graduation season and Christmas are approaching and at these times demand is high - Silveria needs to be ready.  Silveria will also buy chicken feed to look after the animals.  If Silveria buys in bulk she will save a little as the cost will be lower, and she will only have to make one trip - she must travel 20km to buy the chickens, and must pay for a taxi, as there is no public transport.

In the future Silveria would like to expand her farm and to work harder in order for her family to earn high profits.  She wants to see her children become professionals and very successful, and respected in the community.  Silveria also wants her children to learn to work so that, when they grow up, they can work in the community and earn a good life.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Elia Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Elia de 59 años,  estudio hasta 6º grado, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 17 años  que vive con ella, estudia 3º año de bachillerato, en su casa vive su hijo y un hermano de ella. 

Ella ha instalado una tienda, su horario de trabajo es de las 7 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para surtir más la tienda con productos (granos básicos, ropa, churros, golosinas etc.) con el crédito podrá  comprar y vender más,  aumentando sus  ingresos.

En el futuro piensa, surtir mucha más su tienda,  hacerla más grande y por medio del negocio darle el estudio y la educación adecuada a mi hijo para que pueda estudiar en la universidad y llegar hacer un profesional.
texts.en:
Elia is 59 years old and completed up to sixth grade at school.  She is a single mother to one 17-year-old boy, who still lives at home.  He is in high school.  Also living in the house is one of Elia's brothers.

Elia has started a shop and she works from 7am until 5pm.

Elia is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to stock up her business more (with products such as basic grains, clothes, churros, and sweets).  With this loan Elia will be able to buy and sell more, and increase her income.

In the future Elia plans to stock up her business much more, expand it, and, through the business, provide her son with a good upbringing and education so that he can study at university and become a professional.

loans.use: to stock up her store further (with products such as basic grains, clothes, churros, and sweets).

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en:
Asolelei is 30 years old and married with one child. 

She runs a small business selling snacks and fried chicken and rice in her community, and she has been doing this for three years.

Asolelei has requested a loan to buy chicken, cooking oil, rice, noodles, twisties, and soft drinks. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Asolelei will help her family in everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken, cooking oil, rice, noodles, twisties, and soft drinks

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKOLA ont en moyenne  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un des villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines d’arachide et de céréales.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 1ere femme assise de la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  un sac de 100kg  des graines d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent KOUROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU dans son domicile et au marché pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKOLA average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in KOUROUBADOUGOU, a village in Cercle de SAN, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through kinship ties, and they have businesses buying and selling grocery items, such as peanuts and grains. After having correctly paid back the previous farm loans, the women of the group BENKOLA are now on their first solidarity loan. 

DJENEBA, who is the first woman sitting from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase a 100-kg sack of peanuts. She gets her supplies from KOUROUBADOUGOU and from surrounding villages. She makes her sales in KOUROUBADOUGOU to men and women customers paying with cash and sometimes on credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates an electronic shop where he sells speakers, radios, televisions, etc. His business is located in a  highly populated area and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough finances to boost his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of speakers, televisions and other electronics. His business goal is to open more shops within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of speakers, televisions and other electronics

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as calm. 

She operates a vehicle parts store where she sells tires and other vehicle parts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are vehicle drivers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient finances to boost her business. 

Rebeccah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tires and other vehicle parts. Her business goal is to open a garage within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy more tires and other vehicle parts.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being focused. 

Monicah operates a retail stall where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area suitable for the business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests that destroy her cereals. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of cereals for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of grains within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a large store. 

This is Monicah's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to add stocks of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Pinky

texts.en:
Ma. Pinky is 27 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Ma. Pinky is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Pinky has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Pinky would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy  tiene 32 años, casada con dos hijitos de las edades de 9 y 12  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de San Luis,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como abarrotes, aceite y papa,  la Sra. Nancy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old, married, and has two young children aged 9 and 12. She makes a living selling food from her sales stand in the area of San Luis. This is her first loan with the organization, and she is going to use it to buy ingredients such as groceries, oil, and potatoes.

Nancy faces certain challenges in her business, such as competition, as there are several other people who work selling food. Her dream for her business is to keep selling food and to have a restaurant, so that she can offer comfort to her customers, and in this way grow her business, boost her income, and thereby improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old, single, and has 2 adopted children aged 10 and 13 years old. She has a hardware business and has been in the business for three years. Her monthly income from her business is Kes 20,000. 

She will be using the loan to purchase cement, timber, iron sheets, nails and metal. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to open a bigger hardware store.

This is her third loan and she repaid both her previous loans successfully. Jane hopes to own several hardware businesses in future.

loans.use: To buy cement, metal and iron sheets.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as aggressive. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a potential and competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital. 

Beatrice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to increase sales within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be independent. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has a transport business in Naivasha and has been in the business for three years. He is 27 years old, married to Carlo who is a farmer, and together they are blessed with one child.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy two wheels for his vehicle and use the generated income to pay school fees and make some savings.

In the near future, he hopes to own a fourteen-seat vehicle.

loans.use: To buy two vehicle wheels.

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Richelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Richelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, hot dogs, bamboo sticks, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Richelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, hot dogs, bamboo sticks, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 36 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. 

Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 24 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Melissa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store, like snack foods, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Melissa has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

Melissa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Víctor Adalberto

texts.es:
Víctor de 31 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, estudio noveno grado, y actualmente trabaja como vigilante en una ferretería, en la cual  hace turnos de 24 horas y descansa 24 horas, para asistir a su trabajo tiene que viajar en autobús desde su comunidad, sale a las 6 : 00 a.m, y el viaje tarda unos 30 minutos.

 Víctor, necesita hacer algunas mejoras a su casita, las cuales consisten en introducir la energía eléctrica y construir un muro de contención, por lo que sus materiales los comprara en la misma ferretería donde trabaja.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un poste para tendido eléctrico, cable y otros accesorios para hacer la instalación eléctrica de su casa, además comprara ladrillo, piedra, cemento, hierro y otros, para construir un muro, para que no se le erosione su terreno. 

Al tener energía eléctrica podrá tener luz en su casa y sus hijos se entretendrán ya que les comprara una televisión.  Él estará mas desestresado en su descanso, ya que podrá ver televisión y también, se quitara el problema de que la corriente de agua le erosione su terreno   

Víctor, sueña con darle estudio a sus 3 hijos y que puedan ser profesionales, para que tengan mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor is 31 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has 3 children. He went to school through the ninth grade and now works as a guard at a hardware store. He works 24 hour shifts and is off for 24 hours. To get to his job, he has to travel in bus from his community. He leaves at 6:00 a.m. and the trip takes 30 minutes.  

Víctor needs to do some home improvement on his little house. These are installing electrical wiring and putting in a retention wall. He will buy the materials at the hardware store where he works. 

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a post for electrical cables, cable and other accessories to install electrical wiring in his house. He will also buy bricks, stone, cement, iron and more to build a wall so his land doesn't erode. 

With electricity he can have lights in his house and his children will be entertained since he will buy them a television. He will be less stressed when he is off work, since he will be able to watch television and also the problem of water eroding his land will go away.   

Víctor dreams of giving his children an education so they can have good jobs and better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy a post for electrical cables, cable and other accessories to install electrical wiring in his house, as well as buy bricks, stone, cement, iron and more to build a wall so his land won't erode.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deisy  es una persona muy estudiosa, está siguiendo la carrera de Enfermería, comenta que le va muy bien en sus estudios, ya que es una persona dedicada y que quiere salir adelante.
Su sueño es poder ser una gran profesional que ayude a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud. Está luchando por ser alguien en la vida y así cumplir sus sueños.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma estar más cerca de su meta y su sueño.
texts.en: Deisy is a very studious person, who is studying for a degree in nursing. She says that her studies are going very well, as she is devoted to them and wants to succeed. Her dream is to be a successful professional, who helps other people in something so important as health. She is fighting to make something of her life and achieve her dreams. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her university fees, to help her move closer towards her goal and her dream.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a general store, where he sells caps, padlocks, radios, etc. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to boost his business. 

Simon will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stocks of speakers and radios. His business goal is to open an electronics shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children and fulfill his clients' demands. 

This is Simon's second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy stocks of speakers and radios.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old. She is married to Martin and they have been blessed with three children. Her husband also produces additional income for the support of the family. She does farming and  has been in the business for 10 years. She plants cash crops and also keeps cattle.

She will be using the loan to buy more farm inputs for use in her farm. These include fertilizer and seeds as well as cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to improve her farming and also improve the living standard of her family.

This is her fourth loan and her previous loans were repaid successfully. Her hopes in the future is to grow her farming business and be financially stable together with her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs for her farm.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has two children aged 3 years and 5 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a grocery store where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all kinds. 

Paul describes his biggest business challenge to be scarcity of some fruits. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fruit to resell. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will sustain his business economically. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Martha Yenny

texts.es: La Sra. Martha, tiene 50 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en restaurante que se encuentra en la zona de Estación Argentina,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para la ampliación de su restaurante y así  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Martha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, la Sra. Martha es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Martha, 50, makes a living selling food in a restaurant in the Estación Argentina area.

This is Martha's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy tables and chairs to expand her restaurant and offer her customers greater comfort.  She's requesting the loan to continue improving her business.

Martha will use her profits to keep on buying supplies and improving her income.  She wants to have a chain of restaurants and give her customers better service.

Martha's a very hardworking person and she's happy about this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and an awning

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 43 years old and a single mother of three children. She runs a retail shop and a cereals-selling business. She has been in these businesses for three years now and her monthly income is KES 4,500. 

This is Flora's second loan term and she intends to purchase more stocks of  sugar, cooking oil, flour, and cereals such as beans, maize, and rice to sell. She will use the generated income to expand her business and to educate her children. 

Her future hope and dream is to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Shiela Marie

texts.en:
Shiela Marie is 43 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Shiela Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Shiela Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, cooking oil, milk, etc. to sell.

Shiela Marie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, cooking oil, milk, etc. 

Shiela Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, cooking oil, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has three children, with ages ranging from four to ten years. He describes himself as being calm. 

Daniel operates a transport business where he transports customers from one town to another. He also owns a farm where he grows potatoes and carrots. He has been involved in these businesses for six years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to boost his business. 

Daniel will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that, in the future, his business will prevail. 

This is Daniel's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive con mi familia en la cuidad de Paraguarí, Comenta que actualmente está trabajando con su tía, además de eso está estudiando en la ciudad de Paraguarí en la universidad la carrera de Administración de empresa para así poder tener un futuro mejor  y poder ofrecer algo mejor a su familia.
Ella se considera una estudiante muy dedicada, ya que se esfuerza siempre por poder sobresalir y ser la mejor en su clase.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las mensualidades de su facultad y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y trabajando.
texts.en: Maria lives with her family in the town of Paraguarí. She says that at the moment, she is working with her aunt, as well as studying at university in Paraguarí for a degree in business management. In this way, she can have a better future and offer her family something better. She sees herself as a very devoted student, because she always works hard to excel and be top of the class. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her monthly university fees, so that she can keep studying and working.

loans.use: to pay monthly university fees.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa tiene 64 años y  un hijo mayor de edad de 37 años,   ella se dedica al comercio de periódicos teniendo así un puesto de venta en una de  las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de la Paz, la señora Rosa es conocida por la institución como una persona  responsable ya que es cliente antigua, también es conocida en su barrio y lugar de trabajo por ser una persona amable y jovial con sus clientes, la Sra. Rosa con el dinero del crédito comprara revistas por mayor para vender en su puesto, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien por este motivo quiere seguir comprando revistas,  se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Señora Rosa is 64 years old and has one grow-up son aged 37. She makes a living in the newspaper business, with a newspaper stand in one of the busiest streets of the city of  La Paz. Señora Rosa is known by the organization for being a responsible individual, since she is a longstanding client. She is also well-known in her neighborhood for being a friendly, kind person with her customers. With the loan, Rosa will buy magazines in bulk to sell on her stand. Her previous loan was a great success, and that's why she wants to keep buying magazines. She is grateful to the organization for the support it provides in granting loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandize and magazines.

loans.name: Josue Otoniel

texts.es:
Josue de 29 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, es un joven muy emprendedor, estudio séptimo grado. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en el cultivo de pipían y maíz para elote bajo riego. Este oficio lo aprendió con su suegro, para hacer su trabajo cuenta con un motor, 60 tubos y buena cantidad de poliducto, para conducir el agua, en el año saca varias cosechas de pipían y elote, aunque hace cálculos para producir cuando, el mercado no esta saturado de los productos que el siembra. 

Para sembrar sus cultivos, don Josue, compra sus insumos en agro servicio, ya que ahí le venden productos de calidad y a buen precio, para ir a comprar, tiene que abordar un autobús en su comunidad y viajar durante 30 minutos, hasta llegar a la ciudad, luego de comprar, regresa a casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de fertilizante, para sembrar 17,500 metros cuadrados de maíz para elote, bajo riego y terminar de beneficiar 7,000 metros cuadrados de pipían, la cual ya esta nacida.  

Con la inversión, podrá evitar tanto viaje a la ciudad a comprar, ya que incurre en gastos y perdida de tiempo y dará un manejo a tiempo y adecuado a su cultivo, lo que hará que tenga mayor cosecha y mayores ingresos.

Don Josue, esta planificando ahorrar, para darle estudio a sus hijos y que puedan graduarse como profesionales.
texts.en:
Josue is 29 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He is a very enterprising young man and went to school through the seventh grade. He has 6 years of experience growing squash and sweet corn under irrigation. He learned this trade with his father in law. To do his job he has a motor, 60 tubes and a good quantity of rubber hose to move the water. During the year he has several harvests of squash and sweet corn although he times it so he can produce when the market isn't saturated with the products he grows. 

To plant his crops, Josue buys his materials in Agro Servicio. They sell quality products there at a good price. To do his buying, he has to get on a bus in his community and travel 30 minutes until he gets to the city. After buying he goes home.

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer to plant 17,500 square meters of sweet corn under irrigation and to finish helping  7,000 square meters of squash, which is already sprouting.  

With the investment he can avoid so much travel into the city to make his purchases, since he incurs costs and loses time. He will be able to manage his time and help his crops, which will result in having a better harvest and more income.

Josue is planning on saving to give his children an education so they can graduate and have good jobs.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizer to plant 17,500 square meters of sweet corn under irrigation and finish helping 7,000 square meters of squash, which is already sprouting.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing net making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years.

Socorro is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials such as nylon thread and others for her business.  In the future, Socorro would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nylon thread

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and  has four adult children. She operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

Grace is requesting a loan from Yehu for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of maize to sell. She joined Yehu to receive financial support. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es: José, tiene 41 años de edad, está casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace 9 años que se dedica a la venta de artesanía (bisutería) como ser collares, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.  Esta actividad de negocio la realiza en su casa y los vende a los turistas en la orilla de la playa. El préstamo que solicito es por  3,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración  de bisutería, como ser: piedras, cuerda, broches, pines etc. el cual le ayudara a surtir su negocio ya que viene la  buena temporada y quiere tener más productos para vender, Su meta es seguir ayudando a sus hijos en sus estudios y mantener su negocio permanente.
texts.en: José is 41 years old, married, and has three children who live with him in the municipality of Tela. For 9 years, he has been selling artisanal jewelry like necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings etc. He runs his small business from his home and sells his product to tourists on the beach. The loan he is applying for will be invested in the purchase of materials he needs to make his jewelry like stones, cord, brooches, pins etc. This will help him to stock his business because a good selling season is approaching and he would like more product to sell. His goal is to continue helping his children in their studies and to make his business permanent.

loans.use: purchase materials like stones, cord, brooches,  pins and more.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a widowed woman. She has two children, with ages four and seven years. She describes herself as honest. 

Lilian operates a grocery store, where she sells onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are hotels, schools, etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds to expand her business. 

Lilian will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of tomatoes. Her business goal is to open a grocery shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will build a family home. 

This is Lilian's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy stocks of tomatoes.

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en:
Munyazi is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge.

Munyazi is requesting a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell. She decided to join Yehu to receive financial support. Munyazi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS SOÑADORAS,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes Siete mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Fabiola,  ella  se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Fabiola va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio,  la Sra. Fabiola es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que este préstamo le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: The LAS SOÑADORAS entrepreneur's bank is made up of eight members; seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Fabiola, who makes a living selling a variety of soft drinks from her sales stand in a busy market in the city of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with the organization, and Fabiola is going to use it to buy a range of wholesale soft drinks to restock her sales stand, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Fabiola is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided, because this loan will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Don Martin, tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, tiene 8 hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, en un tiempo cultivo caña de azúcar luego empezó a cultivar café, el cual vende en pergamino húmedo y seco en el mercado local de la zona. Con el préstamo que solicita  por 20,000 lempiras va comprar fertilizantes para la finca ya que necesita abono para que el café madure y va sembrar mas planta de café. El tiene como plan ayudarle a sus hijos a que aprendan a sembrar café y mantener bien la finca y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Martin is 44 years old and married with eight children. He lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has always made a living in agriculture. At one time, he grew sugar cane but later began to cultivate coffee, which he sells fresh or dried in his local market. 

With this loan that he is requesting for 20,000 lempiras he is going to purchase fertilizers for his farm. He needs fertilizers so that his coffee plants can mature and so that he can grow more coffee plants. Martin has a plan to help his children learn to plan coffee, carry out farm maintenance and earn a living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm so that his coffee plants mature and he can plant more coffee.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a 29-year-old retail shop proprietor in Bamba Kilifi Kenya. She is the married mother of four (whose spouse provides for additional income). She has been in this business for the last four years doing great.

This marks her fourth borrowing from KADET Ltd, to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase a motor bike for carrying goods and passengers to their destination.  She plans to use the anticipated profit to service her loan and educate her children. 

She hopes to see her business grow in future and own several motor bikes.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike and enter the transportation business.

loans.name: Alois

texts.en:
Alois, 34 years of age, is married to Calviniah and they have been blessed with two children. 

He is a water vendor in Tala town and he supplies water to various environs. His wife also produces additional income to support the family. Alois has been in the water supply business for six years now and it has been profitable.

Alois will be using the loan to buy a bigger handcart for supplying water and more water containers. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to purchase a piece of land for cultivating.

This is Alois' first loan term and his future hopes are to open a retail shop for his wife and also to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy a bigger handcart and water containers.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi, who is a hardworking and enterprising woman, appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more sacks of tea leaves for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Wilber León

texts.es: Wilber es un fotógrafo de 28 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 1 año. Trabaja de manera independiente prestando su servicio a domicilio, para diferentes eventos, pero, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos y motivado por su familia, desea iniciar en compañía de su esposa un estudio de fotografía y publicidad, que inicialmente estará ubicado en su casa, allí prestarán servicios de foto estudios, tomarán fotos para documentos, publicidad para empresas y continuarán prestando el servicio de fotografía y video para eventos a domicilio, cuentan con la ventaja de tener amplio conocimiento en esta labor, ya que su esposa es diseñadora gráfica. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos y materiales de trabajo (impresora, luces, papel fotográfico, tinta, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones del espacio, así podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo, con el que espera generar los recursos económicos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades básicas del hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo. Wilber, con su empuje, proyección y empeño, desea trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio, lograr que sea rentable y que vaya creciendo para luego, tener la oportunidad de ampliarse y montarlo en un local comercial, donde pueda atraer muchos más clientes y genere mejores ganancias, dando como resultado una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 28-year-old photographer. He is married and has a 1-year-old son. He works independently by offering his services at homes for different events but, in the hopes of earning more money for his family, he would like to open a photography and publicity studio with his wife. Initially, the business will be located in their home. There, they will offer services like a photo studio, taking photos for documents, and business publicity. They will also continue to offer their photography and video services for home-based events. He has the advantage of knowing this business well, since his wife is a graphic designer.

He requests the loan to invest in fixed assets and work materials (printer, lights, photo paper, ink, etc.) and make improvements to his space. This way, he will be able to put his project into motion.

He hopes to be able to generate enough economic resources to cover his household's basic necessities and safeguard the well-being of his young son.

Wilber, with his drive, impact, and determination, wants to work hard to move his business forward, make it profitable, and continue improving. He hopes to have the opportunity to expand and open a commercial location where he can attract many more clients and generate more profits, resulting in a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and work materials (printer, lights, photo paper, ink, etc.) and make improvements to his space.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old single woman. She has two children who are 3 and 7 years old. She describes herself to be industrious. 

Mary operates a general store where she sells plastic containers, mirrors, necklaces etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are the general public. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of plastic containers and other items. Her business goal is to have a furniture shop within five years. 

Mary hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTML. A previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully

loans.use: to add stock of plastic containers and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has two children, ages 7 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be creative. 

Esther operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale. She has been involved in her business for seven years. Her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will add more cows. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy feed for her dairy cows

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is married, with six children, three in school and three underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase household consumables such as maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase household consumables such as maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 53 years of age, has a rental housing business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for 18 years. It has been profitable and she has been able to provide for her family's needs with the income from the business. She is married to Stephen and they are blessed with five children.

This is her eleventh loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully. She plans to use this loan amount to pay school fees for her children who are in college. 

Mary hopes to expand her rental housing business in future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 21 years old and single. He describes himself to be creative. 

He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, sweets, maize flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of sugar, maize flour, and other items. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy stocks of sugar, maize flour, and other items for his shop

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. Her previous loan enabled her to install electricity in her rental houses. 

Saumu is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to renovate her rental houses.

Saumu feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
This is Mariamu. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase food ingredients for her food preparing business.  

Mariamu would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

Mariamu looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the missing electronics goods in his shop to resell.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou est un homme âgé de 33ans qui est marié et père de famille. Il habite à coté du guichet et détient un magasin au marché de la commune. Modou évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 15ans. Il sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 400.000F pour acheter des téléphones portables et les revend à ses clients. Il commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Il prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir il souhaite développer son activité à tel point qu'il n'aura plus besoin de crédit
texts.en:
Mr Modou is a 33-year-old man, who is married, with children.  He lives near the field partner office and has a shop in the local market.  Modou has been working in business for more than 15 years.  

He is requesting this loan of 400,000 francs CFA to buy portable telephones to resell to his customers.  He starts his day at 7am and finishes at 8pm.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family and, the school fees of his children.  In the future he would like to expand his business to the point that he no longer needs to borrow loans.

loans.use: to buy portable telephones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Erick Alberto

texts.es:
Erick es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas y para poder solventar sus gastos de estudio trabaja en una avícola como pelador de pollos, el trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana en este oficio y por las tardes va a su centro de estudios, Erick cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y porque quiere ser un profesional.

Erick esta agradecido con los prestamista kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora para poder realizar sus trabajo de estudio, de esta manera podrá seguir estudiando con los materiales necesarios y hacer su gran sueño realidad:” Terminar su carrera y ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Erick, 21, studies business administration.  He works in a poultry-processing plant plucking chickens so he can pay for his education.  He works at this job at 5 in the morning and goes to school in the afternoon.

Erick's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy a computer to do his school work.  This way he'll have the materials he needs to be able to keep on studying and make his big dream a reality: To finish his degree and be a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Olvin Medardo

texts.es: Olvin, tiene 27 años de edad, esta soltero y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a sus padres. El a trabajado como jornalero y en agricultura. Hace 10 años que se dedica al cultivo de (banano) plátano grande, mediano y pequeño.  Es un producto que tiene mucha demanda y se vende en la misma zona. Este préstamo es su primer ciclo y lo solicitó por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos que necesita para darle  mantenimiento y  siembra de plátano, con esta inversión espera sacar mejores cosechas y ganancias. Su meta es poder crecer como micro empresario y tener buena finca.
texts.en:
Olvin, 27 years old, is single and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara, with his parents. He has worked as a day laborer and in agriculture. He has made a living through the cultivation of large, medium, and small bananas. It is a product that has a high demand and is sold in the same area.

This loan is his first cycle and he requested the loan to be for 20,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and other supplies that he needs for the maintenance and sowing of banana trees. With this investment he hopes to have better harvests and profits. His goal is to be able to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and to have a good farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies that he needs for the maintenance and sowing of banana trees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a 34-year-old open air cafeteria owner and motorcycle transport provider in Makupa, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last ten years and is doing great.

This marks her fourth borrowing from KADET to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar and to renovate her kiosk kitchen. She will use the anticipated profit to service her loan. 

Mwanasiti hopes to own a modern cafeteria in the future and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar and to renovate her kiosk kitchen.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José de 56 años, es un hombre  de trabajo; se levanta todos los días a las  4 am.  Para realizar el ordeño de sus vacas y llevar la leche a tiempo, para que sus nietos desayunen antes de irse a la escuela, esto lo comenta con sentimiento ya que su padre hacia lo mismo  con él  y sus hermanos. 

Él estudio hasta  4° grado de educación básica, ya que en su comunidad era el grado máximo, su esposa es su ayuda incondicional, ella se dedica a realizar un arduo trabajo  en la casa  para preparar los productos derivados de la leche  y así comercializarlos. 

José es agricultor desde que lo recuerda, al lado de su padre y tres hermanos, trabajo la tierra aprendiendo todo lo que hasta hoy en día conoce. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de insumos agrícolas: un saco de fórmula, dos de sulfato,  una caneca de pesticida  y dos litros de foliar, para cultivar 4 tareas de cultivo entre pipián,  yuca y ayote.  

En el futuro piensa seguir cultivando  la tierra, con el fin  de dar el sustento  a su familia  y apoyar a sus 2 últimos hijos con sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
José, 56 years old, is a working man. He gets up every day at 4 a.m. to milk his cows and get the milk on time, and so that his grandchildren eat breakfast before going to school. He says this with emotion since his father did the same with him and his brothers.

He studied until the 4th grade in primary school since in his community it was the highest grade available. His wife is his unconditional help. She makes a living working hard at home to prepare the products derived from the milk and sell them.

José has been a farmer for as long as he can remember. He worked the earth at his father’s and his three brothers’ sides, learning everything that he still knows today.

The loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies: one sack of fertilizer, two of sulfate, one basket of pesticide, and two liters of foliar feed to cultivate four crops, among them pipián, yucca, and pumpkin.

In the future he thinks he will continue cultivating the earth, with the goal of providing sustenance to his family and supporting his two last children in their university studies.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies: one sack of fertilizer, two of sulfate, one basket of pesticide, and two liters of foliar feed to cultivate four crops, among them pipián, yucca, and pumpkin.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es:
José de 27 años,  estudio hasta noveno grado, es una persona acompañada, convive junto a su esposa que se dedica a las actividades domesticas  y han procreado tres hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela,  y  dependen de las actividades que realiza.


él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, que lo realiza  por su propia cuenta,anteriormente lo hacia con su padre de quien aprendió el oficio. él viaja dos kilómetros a pie hasta donde tiene el cultivo de maíz,y en la tarde se dedica a realizar labores de jornal  .

 Con el crédito comprara tres vacas lecheras, ya que desea comprar vacas para producir leche y generar más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.


Desea,  comprar mas vacas y producir lácteos  como queso, crema, etc. para la venta
texts.en:
Jose, 27 years old, studied until the ninth grade. He in a relationship; he lives with his wife who makes a living through domestic work. They have had three children who attend school and depend on the work he does.

He has made a living through agriculture for 20 years, which he does on his own. Previously he worked with his father, from whom he learned the profession. He travels two kilometers on foot to where he has his corn crop, and in the afternoon he works as a day laborer.

With the loan, he will buy three milk cows, since he wishes to buy cows to produce milk and generate a higher income for supporting his family. He wishes to purchase more cows and produce milk products, such as cheese, cream, etc., to sell.

loans.use: to purchase three milk cows.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a widowed woman with seven children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.

For over three years, Alina has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 50,000, Alina wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman with two children, one younger than school age and the other who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past fifteen years, Mwanasha has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000, Mwanasha wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has a business of supplying breads and cakes in Naivasha, and he has been in the business for three years. 

He is 38 years old and married to Daisy.   Together they are blessed with two children, who are in school.

This is his fourth loan term from KADET LTD.  Timothy plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of breads and cakes so as to meet the demand of his customers. He will use the generated income to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business to become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy breads and cakes for sale.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Doña Marilu en su primer crédito con los fondos financiados por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA pudo lograr su objetivo de comprar insumos como abono, fertilizantes, foliares, urea que dieron protección a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol pudiendo proteger 2 manzanas de tierra cultivada con lo que pudo obtener una cosecha de 24 cargas. Ella mejoro mucho sus cultivos y al ver la cosecha obtenida pensó en el bienestar también de su familia la venderlo pero como todo en la vida tiene ventajas y desventajas el precio de compra venta de estos productos bajo por lo que no pudo vender todo el grano en su totalidad gracias al exceso de cosecha que hay en el país por lo que no pudo cancelar su compromiso. Ella solicito un nuevo financiamiento de su préstamo con el fin de cultivar su postrera y esperar que el precio mejore para poder venderla y obtener una buena ganancia la cual la re invertirá en la siembra de nueva plantación de café.
texts.en:
In Marilu's first loan using funds financed by different lenders through Kiva, she was able to achieve her aim of buying supplies such as manure, fertilizers, foliar feeds and urea which sustained her corn and bean crops. She was able to look after 2 hectares of cultivated land, getting a harvest of 24 loads. She improved her crops a lot and when she saw the harvest she had produced she though of her family's wellbeing. However, when she came to sell, like everything in life there are good times and bad times, the price for buying and selling these crops had gone down. She was unable to sell all of her grain due to the country's surplus harvest, and so she was unable to pay off her debt.

Marilu is asking for a new loan with the aim of sowing a second harvest and hoping that the price improves so she can sell it and make a good profit, which she will reinvest in planting new coffee plants.

loans.use: to sow a second crop and further improve her coffee, corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 57 años muy trabajadora, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio de venta de comida típica, el cual logro iniciar con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, sobre todo porque ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos, a los cuales quiere mucho; Olga cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Olga agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá realizar mejoras en el ambiente de su negocio  y mejoras en su vivienda, en especial mejorar el techo, ya que ha llovido mucho, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante.”
texts.en:
Olga, 57, is a very hardworking woman.  She gets up very early every day to attend to her business selling traditional food.  She managed to start her business with a lot of effort and savings, and has gotten ahead with her four children, whom she loves very much.  Olga believes it's going well for her in her business because she's very well known and her food tastes good.

Olga's grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders because thanks to them she'll be able to make improvements to her business and her house, especially the roof because it has rained a lot.

This way she'll be able to improve her quality of life, better serve her customers, and continue striving to realize her big dream of having a great restaurant.

loans.use: to improve her home and her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice does farming in Kangundo town, where she keeps dairy cattle and plants cash crops. 

She is 23 years old and married to Wilson, and they are blessed with one child. Her spouse produces additional income. 

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds for planting. She will also buy more stock of dairy feed for her dairy cattle. 

She will use the anticipated profits from her business to educate her daughter and make sure her family is financially stable.

This is her 3rd loan term.  Her future hopes are to make sure that her family is stable, and everybody is independent.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for planting and feed for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan.  It improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is now requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to add more stocks of household consumables, such as sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables such as sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y su hija, desde hace 15 años tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal que consiste en venta de pollo y variedad de embutidos, la cual la atiende junto a su hija desde las 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 3:00 p.m., no ha tenido ningún inconveniente que le haya interrumpido  mantenerse con el negocio. Con la inversión comprara pollo, salchichas, mortadela, jamón, etc.
Ella espera mejorar su economía, satisfacer más a sus clientes, ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece, con los ingresos ella pagara sus deudas y apoyar en los gastos de su casa.
Su sueño es tener los ingresos necesarios para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y apoyar a su esposo en la compra de una máquina de coser, ya que él es sastre.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and her daughter. She has had a stall in the town's market for 15 years selling chicken and a variety of cold meats. María works there with her daughter from 6am until 3pm and she has had no problems which have got in the way of running the business.

With the loan she will buy chicken, sausages, mortadella, ham etc. She hopes to improve her finances, satisfy her customers better and widen the range of products she offers. She will use her income to pay off her debts and help towards the household expenses. 

Her dream is to have enough income to provide better living conditions for her family and to help her husband to buy a sewing machine, as he is a tailor.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mortadella, ham etc.

loans.name: Jamal Aden

texts.en:
Jamal Aden is 28 years old. He is a university student as well as a teacher at Salama Secondary School. He is single and not married yet. His major problem is the lack of a laptop and he cannot buy one on his own.

Jamal will use the laptop to prepare his assignments and presentations, to download lessons, and also to prepare school exams, exercises and student grade marks. Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. 

Surely, getting the laptop will improve his education level as he will have access to the Internet. He will get more knowledge and a heavy load on his shoulders will be lifted.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Abdifatah Mohamed

texts.en: Abdifatah is 23 years old and he is a university student. He studies at Admas University College, faculty of economics. He is in the last semester and wants to prepare a research paper or thesis book. Unfortunately, he has no laptop to write the research paper. He came to Kaaba MFI and got the laptop as a loan. Now he can use the laptop for his research paper and other educational purposes.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Khalid Yusuf

texts.en: Khalid Yusuf is 22 years old. He studies at Gollis University Faculty of Civil Engineering. He needs laptop but can't buy one. Khalid got information about laptop loans. After he fulfilled the Kaaba loan requirement, Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. He will use the laptop for his university studies. After finishing at unversity Khalid hopes to work for a local construction company as an engineer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Sakariye Abdilahi

texts.en:
Sakariye Abdilahi is 20 years old. He finished his studies at Gollis University, faculty of civil engineering. He works for a construction company, and he is a home designer. 

He needs a laptop to do his work. Kaaba provided him with a laptop, which he will pay for in monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Mukhtar Hussein

texts.en:
Mukhtar is 35 years old. He is married and has five children. He is an MBA student at Jomokenyata University at its branch in Hargeisa. Mukhtar is also a lecturer at Gollis University. 

There are many challenges he faces in both his learning and teaching, as he has no laptop. Lecturers use a projector when they are teaching the students, and without a laptop, it is a really big problem. 

Mukhtar needs a laptop, so he requested that Kaaba give him a laptop, which he will pay for in monthly repayments. Now he is on a waiting list, and Kaaba will provide him with the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Ahmed Hassan

texts.en:
Ahmed Hassan is 23 years old. He is a secondary school student. He wants to start at university, as he is finishing school this year.

He needs a laptop and requested that Kaaba give him a laptop as a loan; then he will pay installments. Now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Ahmed will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Mohamed Mahad

texts.en:
Mohamed Mahad is 31 years old. He graduated from the University of Hargeisa. He works for a local NGO; a project called Youth Education Package. 

Mohamed always goes to the field, and he needs a laptop to use when he goes to the field. He can't buy the laptop, but can pay monthly installments. Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for working purposes

loans.name: Fadhia Ali

texts.en:
Fadhia Ali is a 28-year-old single girl. She studies Information Technology at New Horizon College. 

Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to have practical practices. She has informed Kaaba-Kiva that she would like to have a laptop loan. She requested that they provide a laptop, and then she will pay installments. 

Now she is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Fadhia Ali will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Farhan Ahmed

texts.en:
Farhan is 26 years old. He finished at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of business adminstration. He works as an accountant.

Farhan needs a laptop to improve his accounting skills, and wants to learn some extra accounting packages. He applied for a Kaaba laptop loan product, and now he is waiting for the laptop. 

Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Farhan will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abas Abdi

texts.en:
Abas Abdi is 20 years old. He finished secondary school this year. Abas wants to start at the university in September of this year. 

Before he starts at the university, he wants to prepare and have a laptop. Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abdirahman Hassan

texts.en:
Abdirahman Hassan is 30 years old and has three children. He finished his studies at the University of Hargeisa. 

Abdirahman needs a loan laptop. He is a secondary school teacher. He needs the laptop to prepare school lessons, exams and homework. 

Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Mohamed Faisal

texts.en:
Mohamed is 19 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of business administration. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, read his lessons when given as soft copy, and download extra lessons.

He requested that Kaaba give him a laptop as a loan, and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis tiene 41 años, para poder salir adelante ha logrado iniciar su negocio de reparación de motos, con lo cual puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manutención de su familia, ya que es padre de 2 hijos de 16 y 10 años, a los cuales quiere muchísimo; Denis también trabaja ofreciendo sus servicios para trabajos de electricidad, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra; Denis cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque es muy carismático.

Denis está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá  comprar herramientas y equipos para su negocio de reparación como gatas, alicates, llaves, tuercas, entre otros, así  podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”
texts.en:
Denis, 41, has started his own motorcycle repair business to get ahead and be able to earn income this way to cover his family’s expenses since he’s father of two children aged 16 and 10 who he loves very much.  Denis also works as an electrician to earn extra income.  He believes he’s doing well in business because he’s very kind but above all because he’s very charismatic.

Denis is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to buy tools and equipment like jacks, pliers, screwdrivers, wrenches, nuts, etc. for his repair shop to offer better customer service and continue striving to make his great dream reality.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:

She has been in her business for the last 13 years and has done great. Her husband provides for additional income.

This marks Anne's fourth borrowing from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase handbags for ladies to stock her boutique in her salon and to purchase paint for her rental shops to improve their appearance. 

Anne will use the anticipated profits to service her loan. She looks forward to opening up several branches of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase handbags for ladies and paint for painting her rental shops

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 19 años, estudio hasta educación media, es una persona soltera, convive junto a sus padres quienes están enfermos,  y  dependen de las actividades que realiza durante el día a día  


Sr. José, se dedica a la agricultura el cual tiene 10 años de hacerlo por su propia cuenta,anterior lo hacia con su padre de quien aprendió el oficio. El viaja un kilómetro a pie hasta donde tiene el cultivo de maíz,y en la tarde se dedica a cuidar el ganado que posee y el de otras personas  .

 Con el crédito comprara dos vacas lecheras, ya que las que posee no producen suficiente leche y no le generan suficiente ingresos, para el sustento de su familia y por ello, comprara las vacas lecheras

 José planea comprar un terreno en donde poder tener sus animales, ya que actualmente alquila y le genera màs gastos.
texts.en:
José, 19, studied up to secondary school.  He’s single living with his parents who are ill and depend on the activities he does day to day.  José has been working independently in agriculture for ten years.  He used to work alongside his father from whom he learned the occupation.   He walks one kilometer to reach his corn field and in the afternoon he cares for cattle of his own and cattle belonging to others.

He will use the loan to buy two dairy cows because the ones he has aren’t producing enough milk and don’t generate high enough income to support his family which is why he will buy dairy cows.  José plans to buy a piece of land where he can keep his animals because he currently leases land and that generates more costs.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DAKAN ont en moyenne  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un de villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe DAKAN sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  deux 100kg sacs des graines d’arachide et 100kgs de maïs. Elles s’approvisionnent KOUROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU et KIMPARANA pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Dakan Group are, on average, 40 years old with 5 children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in the San area, which is the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.  The women know one another through family ties, and work buying and selling seeds.  This will be the women of the Dakan Group's first group loan after fully repaying their previous farming loans.

Djeneba is the woman standing on the far left of the picture.  She intends to use this loan to buy two 100kg sacks of peanut seeds and 100kg of maize seeds.  The women buy their supplies in Kouroubadougou and the surrounding villages.  They sell their products in Kouroubadougou and Kimparana, on market days, to male and female customers, for cash or, often, credit.  They hope to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA.  Their earnings will be used to cover health, food, clothing and school expenses.  Their remaining earnings will be reinvested into their businesses.

loans.use: to buy peanut and maize seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy physiotherapy supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: This is Mwanakombo. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and take good care of her family. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables for her business.

loans.name: Neyber Edenilson

texts.es:
Neyber es un joven de 25 años,  estudio hasta noveno grado, es una persona acompañada, convive junto a su esposa que se dedica a las actividades domesticas  y sus dos hijos.


Él  se dedica a la agricultura, el cual tiene 15 años de hacerlo por su propia cuenta y con su padre quien le enseño el oficio.  Viaja un kilómetro a pie, hasta donde tiene el terreno donde cultiva,y en la tarde se dedica a  a cuidar el ganado

 Con el crédito comprara una yunta de Bueyes, para arar su terreno, además podrá prestar sus servicios a otras personas, lo que  genera más ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 


Él desea adquirir, un terreno donde construir su vivienda, ya que actualmente vive cuidando una propiedad de un familiar.
texts.en:
25-year-old Neyber has studied as far as ninth grade and lives with his wife who looks after the house and their two children. Neyber has worked in agriculture for 15 years, on his own and with his father who taught him the skills. He walks a kilometre to get to the land which he cultivates, and in the afternoon he looks after the livestock.

He will use the loan to buy a pair of oxen to plough his land. He will also be able to hire out his services to other people, which will bring him more income to support his family.

Neyber wants to buy a plot of land where he can build his house, since currently they live in a property belonging to a family member and look after it.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen to plough his land.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
El señor Teófilo tiene 42 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 6 hijos. Reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Bárbara.
Teófilo es agricultor, produce granos básicos y café. 
Con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar, hace cuatro años que logro establecer un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar: harina, arroz, fríjoles, manteca, golosinas, churros, pan, café, jabón, pastillas de uso común y otros.
La esposa de Teófilo apoya atendiendo la clientela en la pulpería como una forma de contribuir también a la economía familiar.
Con el fin de surtir mas su negocio ha solicitado otro préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de más alimentos: arroz, fríjoles, manteca, productos de limpieza, refrescos y golosinas.
Él espera lograr que sus hijos estudien en una buena escuela y que su negocio crezca para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 42 years old and lives in a common law union with his wife and has six children. He lives with his family in a rural community in Nueva Frontera in the Department of Santa Barbara. Teofilo is a farmer and produces staple grains and coffee. Four years ago he opened a grocery store to generate additional income for his family and sells basic staples such as flour, rice, beans, lard, snacks, chips, bread, coffee, soap, common use medicines, etc. Teofilo's wife helps him take care of customers in the grocery store as a way of helping contribute to the family's income. 

In order to stock up his store he has requested another loan in the amount of 15,000 Lempiras which he plans to invest in the purchase of more supplies such as rice, beans, lard, cleaning products, soft drinks and snacks. His goal is for his children to study in a good school and for his business to grow so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, lard, cleaning products, soft drinks and snacks to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед простой таксист из Хамадони в возрасте 33 лет. Он начал свою деятельность год назад. Чамшед целыми днями перевозит людей из одного села до другого. Общается с новыми людьми и встречается со старыми. У Чамшеда нет выходных, как и у любого таксиста. Поэтому его машина часто нуждается в ремонте. Чамшед в данный момент остро нуждается в кредите, чтобы приобрести авто запчасти и отремонтировать свою машину. Ведь с помощью предоставления услуги такси Чамшед зарабатывает себе и своей семье на жизнь. У Чамшеда жена и двое детей. Такси является основным и единственным доходом в их семью. Помогите Чамшеду!
texts.en:
Jamshed is a simple taxi driver aged 33 from Hamadoni. He began his activities a year ago. All day, Jamshed transports people from one village to the other. He talks with new people and meets with old ones. Jamshed does not have weekends, just like any taxi driver. Therefore, his car often needs repairs.
