Jamshed is currently in need of a loan in order to acquire car parts and to repair his car. Through the provision of taxi services, Jamshed earns a living for himself and his family. Jamshed has a wife and two children. The taxi is the main and sole source of income for the family.

loans.use: to acquire auto parts for car repairs

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne  27 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un des villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. MAMA 1ere femme debout à gauche  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  deux 100kgs sacs des graines d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent KOUROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU  pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya Group are, on average, 27 years old and have 2 children.  They all live in traditional, extended families in Kouroubadougou, which is one of the villages in the San area, which is the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.  The women know one another through family ties, and their business is buying and selling seeds.  This will be the women of the Djiguiya Group's first group loan, after fully repaying their previous farming loans.  

Mama is the woman standing on the far left of the photo.  She will use her loan to buy two 100kg sacks of peanut seeds.  The women buy their supplies in Kouroubadougou and the surrounding villages.  They sell their products in Kouroubadougou on market days, to male and female customers.  The sales are made for cash or, often, credit.  The group hope to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, which will be used to pay health, food, clothing and school expenses.  The remaining earnings will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has a butchery business in Naivasha and has been in this business for 7 years. He is 42 years old, married, and together they are blessed with two children, ages six and three years old.

This is his sixth loan term from KADET Ltd. and plans to use the amount to buy live stock, e.g. cows, goats, and sheep. He will use the generated income to pay school fees and expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to open a second butchery in another area.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, and sheep.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in the business of hawking clothes in Naivasha town and has been in this business for one year. She is 43 years old, married, and together they are blessed with one child, age eighteen years old.

This is her third loan term from KADET Ltd., and plans to use the amount to buy more bales of clothes for her business. She will use the generated income to pay school fees and expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to open a shop to make her business stable.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, and has been in this business for 28 years. She is 56 years old, married, and has no children under her support. 

She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy fertilizer and a heifer, after paying her previous loans successfully. With anticipated profit, she plans to boost her farming business.

In the near future,she hopes to increase her income from farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a heifer.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with four children, three in school and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second-hand clothing for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanamkuu is requesting 30,000 KES to purchase bales of clothing for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: José Dilfido

texts.es:
José de 50 años, debido a la condición económica de su familia no pudo estudiar, mas que un quinto grado; ya que su familia tenia pocos recursos y su padre quien trabajaba la agricultura tenia que ayudar y siendo uno de los mayores tenia que apoyarlo para mantener a su familia, es casado.

De sus 4 hijos, 3 están con él, dos están estudiando un bachillerato y un sexto grado respectivamente y el otro solo le ayuda a trabajar la agricultura. Todos ellos dependen de él y su señora.

Él se dedica a trabajar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de frijol a esta actividad se a dedicado desde que estaba muy joven ya que su padre le inculco a trabajar a valerse por si mismo; ademas se dedica a trabajar como albañil cuando la temporada agrícola termina, ya que es el único que trabaja para mantener a su familia. Sus trabajos los realiza a dos cuadras de su casa ya que cerca le rentan para que trabaja, todo el día trabaja y cuida sus animales al mismo tiempo, el que le ayuda a trabajar es su hijo mayor. Cuando termina la temporada agrícola, trabaja como albañil, lo hace todo el día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 vacas de repasto.

 Espera para un futuro sacar adelante a sus hijos, si es posible hasta la universidad, con el préstamo espera trabajar en la agricultura y con el comprara ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
Because of his family’s economic situation, José, 50, was unable to attend school beyond fifth grade; his family was of scarce resources and he had to help his father work in agriculture since he was one of the older children and had to help him support the family.  He’s married and three of his four children still live with him.  Two are in high-school, one is in 6th grade and the other one helps him with the agricultural work.  All of them depend on him and his wife.

He works 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans.  He’s been doing this since he was very young since his father taught him how to work and to fend for himself.  In addition, he also works in construction when the agricultural season is over since he’s the only one that works to support the family.  

His work takes place two blocks from home on land he leases.  He works all day and cares for his livestock at the same time.  His oldest son helps him do the work.  When the agricultural season ends he works in construction all day.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three head of cattle to put out to pasture.  He hopes in future to move his children forward all the way to university if possible.  He hopes to use the loan to work in agriculture and to buy cattle to pasture.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle.

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es:
Bremilda tiene 43 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en el Distrito de Cayaltí una zona donde su principal actividad de los pobladores es la ganadería, agricultura y comercio a una hora de la Provincia de Chiclayo que se encuentra ubicada en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 5 años es conocida por su labor de dedicarse a la crianza y venta de animales atendiendo así a la demanda de sus clientes que a la vez son sus vecinos.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar animales y poder ofrecerlos en el mercado de su distrito generando así mayores ganancias, Bremilda es un cliente recurrente anteriormente también ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar préstamos lo que le ha permitido posicionarse en este rubro.
texts.en:
Bremilda, 43, lives with her husband and minor son in Cayaltí District, a zone whose residents work primarily in animal husbandry, agriculture and commerce; it’s located an hour from Chiclayo Province which is in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

For the last five years she’s been known for her activity raising and selling livestock meeting customer demand in the area.  Her customers are also her neighbors.

She’s asked for a 1,500 new sol loan to buy livestock to sell in the district market to generate higher profits.  Bremilda is a recurring client.  She’s had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans that have made it possible for her to position herself in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Durdiniyaz

texts.ru: Дурдинияз умелая и опытная швея, проживающая в районе Вахш. Ей 45 лет. У нее есть муж, двое дочерей и трое сыновей. Ее муж работает следователем. Старшая дочь вместе с матерью занимается шитьем, остальные дети являются школьниками. Дурдинияз вот уже 9 лет принимает заказы на шитье женских национальных платьев и зарабатывает на жизнь таким образом. Она научилась этому ремеслу у своей соседки. Дурдинияз вместе со своей дочерью за день вышивают по два платья. Сейчас она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Дурдинияз запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить больше тканей и материалов и таким образом получать больше заказов для шитья. Это естественно увеличит ее доход.
texts.en:
Durdiniyaz is a skilled and experienced seamstress, residing in the Vahsh area. She is 45 years old. She has a husband, two daughters and three sons. Her husband works as an investigator. The elder daughter is engaged in sewing with her mother, while the other children are in school. 

For nine years, Durdiniyaz has been taking orders for sewing women's national dresses and earns a living in this way. She learned this craft from her neighbor. Durdiniyaz and her daughter embroider two dresses per day. Now she wants to expand her operations. Durdiniyaz is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and materials, and in this way to receive more sewing orders. This will significantly increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for sewing women's dresses

loans.name: Luz Mabel

texts.es:
Luz Mabel tiene 47 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo e hijos, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí conocida por el comercio y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque en la parte norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, su esposo trabaja desde hace 10 años trasportando en su mototaxi a sus vecinos y transeúntes que lo soliciten.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por salir adelante y así educar a sus menores hijos, Luz Mabel ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar animales pequeños y alimentos para la crianza de los mismos ofreciéndolos así a la demanda insatisfecha en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Luz Mabel, 47, is married living with her husband and children in a small community in the rural part of Cayaltí known for commerce and agriculture and located an hour from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region in northern Peru.

She works raising small animals for subsequent sale.  Her husband has worked for ten years transporting neighbors and passers-by in his mototaxi as requested.

They are a united family that strives to get ahead and educate their minor children.  Luz Mabel has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 new soles to buy small animals and feed to raise them and meet unmet demand in her community.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 37 years old and married to John, and together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has practiced for twenty-three years. She has applied for a fifth loan from KADET, after paying her previous loans successfully, to enable her to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to boost her farming business to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Niño Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 49 años de edad, es casada vive junto a su esposo y sus 02 hijos en la comunidad de Tarapacá una zona rural de Zaña un distrito que se dedica al comercio y agricultura, actividad que fue facilitada por las obras de regadío de la Cultura Mochica, que se encuentra ubicada a 1hora 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la región Lambayeque en la parte norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener mejores condiciones de vida, Ana María se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y es reconocida por esta labor y su esposo alquila su mototaxi.

Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos de sus alimentos y la compra de animales menores y cubrir de esta manera la demanda insatisfecha en este ultimo permitiéndole tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana María, 49, is married living with her husband and two children in the community of Tarapacá in the rural part of Zaña, a district dedicated to commerce and agriculture which is an activity made easier by the irrigation project done by the Mochica people.  It’s located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo belonging to Lambayeque Region in northern Peru.

They are a unified family that strives to improve their living conditions.  Ana María works selling prepared food and is known for this work; her husband leases his mototaxi.

She’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,000 new sol loan to buy ingredients for her meals and to buy small animals the latter to meet unmet demand and to earn higher income this way.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Фазилат женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она родилась в 1959 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж предприниматель. Фазилат давно мечтала организовать свой бизнес и иметь собственный источник дохода. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе активно и получила сертификат. Она теперь имеет возможность организовать свой бизнес. Фазилат планирует организовать свой бизнес садоводством. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения и саженцев. Она мечтает, чтобы ее сад был цветущим и прекрасным. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fazilat is a woman with a beautiful soul and pleasant thoughts. She was born in 1959. She is married and has three children. Her husband is employed. 

Fazilat has long dreamed of organizing her own business and to have her own source of income. She participated in a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She actively took part in this course and received a certificate. She now has the opportunity to organize her own business. Fazilat plans to start a gardening business. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seedlings. She dreams that her garden will be blossoming and beautiful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for organizing a new gardening business

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aliou est un jeune de 27 ans, marie récemment  et qui n’a pas encore d’enfants. Il évolue dans le domaine de l’agriculture et cela il y a tout juste trois ans. Aliou mettait de l’argent de cote et voila qu’il sent le besoin maintenant, de réaliser quelque chose, c’est pourquoi, il s’est rapproche de l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir bénéficier d’un financement pour compléter et acquérir un terrain. Ce terrain, il le prend comme un investissement a long ou moyen terme, car il pourra le revendre d’ici quelques temps. Aliou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille grâce aux revenus  de son activité agricole. 
Il  aimerait bien voir son capital augmenter afin de pouvoir diversifier et agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mr Aliou is a young man of 27 years, who married recently and has no children yet.  He has worked in agriculture for three years.  Aliou has been saving money for some time and would now like to realise a personal project.  This is why he has approached the field partner, UIMCEC, for a loan to buy a piece of land.  This land will be a medium- to long-term investment project which he intends to sell at some time in the future.  

Aliou is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family, which he achieves with the earnings from his agricultural work.  He would like to see his capital increase so that he can diversify and improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land which will be resold at some time in the future.

loans.name: Nahodha Group

texts.en:
Tumaini, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running different types of businesses: selling fruits and vegetables in a vegetable shop and fabrics and sarongs door to door.

This will be Tumaini's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the fruits and vegetable and start selling fabrics and sarong. 

She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit for school fee payments, loan repayments, and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, fabrics, and sarong to resell. She dreams of owning a hardware shop.

Tumaini will share this loan with her loan group, Nahodha, with fourteen members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, fabrics, and sarong to resell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 50 years old, from Nyahururu. His spouse is Jennifer, who is a businesswoman, and he has seven children, aged 27, 25, 23, 18, 16, 13 and 10. Samuel is a butcher, and has been running his business for the past 19 years. As a way to continue providing a constant supply of meat to his customers, who have become more numerous over time, Samuel has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd. which will be used to buy goats, sheep and cows for slaughter. Samuel's present income is KES 30,000, and he looks forward to using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to improve his agricultural activities. He hopes that in the future he will be the most successful businessman in his village.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more goats, sheep and cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Amalia Esperanza

texts.es:
Amelia Esperanza tiene 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Zaña una comunidad conocida por el trabajo de obras de regadío que hizo la Cultura Mochica y que ha facilitado a sus pobladores la actividad de la agricultura y la visita de turistas de todo el mundo. Se encuentra ubicada a 1 hora 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo perteneciente a la Región Lambayeque en la Costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza y trabaja mucho por tener una mejor calidad de vida, Amelia Esperanza se dedica a la venta de productos de perfumería, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; su esposo trabaja como chofer transportando a lso pobladores de Zaña a Chiclayo.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de productos de Bazar con el que incrementara su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Amelia Esperanza, 38, lives with her husband and two children in Zaña District, a community known for the irrigation project built by the Moche people and that’s made the agricultural work of the residents easier and attracts tourists from all over the world.  It’s located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo that belongs to Lambayeque Region in Peru’s northern coast.

They are a unified family that strives and works hard to attain better quality of life.  Amelia Esperanza sells perfume, women’s, men’s’ and children’s clothes.  Her husband works as a driver transporting residents from Zaña to Chiclayo.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,500 new sol loan to buy stock merchandise for her store to increase business and generate higher income that will lead to improved quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 24-years-old, married and she has been blessed with one child of two years old. She sells clothes and she has been in business for one year and right now her monthly income from the business is ksh 28,700. She is borrowing a loan of ksh 30,000. She will use this loan to add more bales of clothes to her business and will use the anticipated profit from the business to expand her business. She will plough back the profit to the business. This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Christmas lights and decorations.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is asking for a loan because she wants to improve her living standards. The previous loan enabled her to buy gallons of petrol for resale.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

The loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting will help her renovate her house and buy more gallons of petrol for resale.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy more gallons of petrol for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 30 years old and married to Julius. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling cereals for the last 12 years with a monthly income of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She has managed to get her first loan with KADET LTD. of 20,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase more cereals as stock for her business. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business and sell cereals wholesale. Her hopes and dreams are to be successful.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals as stock.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 37 years old, married to Peter and together they are blessed with five children who are in school.

She is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has practiced for thirteen years. She has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd., after repaying her previous loans successfully, to enable her to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for labor. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open a general shop.

She hopes to get bigger loans from Kadet Ltd. to boost her farming business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay for labor

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase soap, sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a food stall, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She also sells cashew nuts to supplement her income. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and two sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and two sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила жизнерадостная и доброжелательная женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Со своей семьёй она живёт в маленьком посёлке. С мужем она старается много работать, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Сама Чамила занимается купли продажей молочных продуктов на местном рынке. А её муж и младший сын работают плотниками. Сейчас Чамила собирается женить своего сына и занимается подготовкой всего необходимого для этого мероприятия. Она закупает разные вещи, бытовую технику, мебель и тому подобное для молодожён. Но она столкнулась с проблемой того, что ей не хватает сейчас финансов для того, чтобы закупить постельные принадлежности в подарок своему сыну, а также национальную одежду для невесты. Для этого Чамила обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку постельных принадлежностей и одежду. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Jamila is a happy and kind woman.  She is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a small village.  She and her husband try to work a lot in order to provide their children with everything necessary.  Jamila is involved in buying and selling dairy products at a local market.  Her husband and youngest son work as carpenters.  Now Jamila is planning to marry off her son and is preparing everything necessary for this event.  She is buying various things, consumer electronics, furniture and the like for young people.  She ran into a problem of not having enough finances to buy bedding as a gift for her son and also national clothing for the bride.  This is why Jamila came to Arvand and wishes to obtain a loan to purchase bedding and clothing.  She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support and hopes very much for a positive result.

loans.use: to purchase bedding and clothing

loans.name: Tari Mai

texts.en:
Tari Mai is 39 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 18.

Many years ago, she established her business making statues.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.

In the future, Tari Mai plans to uplift the economic conditon of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Kobekoun Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOBEKOUN ont en moyenne  33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un des villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe KOBEKOUN sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. MAH 1ere femme  debout de la droite vers la gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  deux 100kgs sacs des graines d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent à KOUROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU et KIMPARANA pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kobekoun Group are, on average, 33 years old, with 4 children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Kouroubadougou, which is one of the villages in the San area, which is the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali.  The women know one another through family ties, and their business is buying and selling seeds.  This will be the Kobekoun Group's first group loan after fully repaying their previous farming loans.

Mah is the woman standing on the far right of the picture.  She will use her loan to buy two 100kg sacks of peanut seeds.  The women buy their supplies in Kouroubadougou and the surrounding villages.  They sell their products in Kouroubadougou and Kimparana on market days, to male and female customers.  The sales are made for cash or, often, credit.  The women hope to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA which will be used for health, food and school expenses.  The remaining earnings will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 22 years old. He is an agro-vet and yet to marry. Joseph has been an agro-vet for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his parents and siblings and meet his own needs.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to purchase more pesticides, herbicides and other agrovet chemicals to boost his business. 

With the anticipated profit form the business he will pay school fees for his brothers and sister. 

His hopes and dreams are to have profit-making business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of pesticides and herbicides

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо 34 года. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Дилрабо замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дилрабо давно искала источника дохода, так как она жила очень бедно. Дилрабо 4 месяца назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, для того, чтобы развевать свои навыки по введению бизнеса. Она так хочет развевать свой новый бизнес и получить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is 34 years old. She is a hardworking and cheerful woman. Dilrabo is married and has two children. Dilrabo has long searched for a source of income since she has been living very poorly. 

Four months ago, Dilrabo started her own business raising livestock. She took part in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women, in order to develop her business administration skills. She wants so much to develop her business and earn an income. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing a new business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, seasoning, etc. for her food-vending business. She has been in this business for eleven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending business.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, seasoning, etc. for her food-vending business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 43 years old, married to Grace and together they are blessed with three children who are in school.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has practiced for one year.  He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds and sheep after repaying his previous loans successfully. With the anticipated profit, he plans to open a general shop.

He hopes to get bigger loans from Kadet Ltd. to boost his farming business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and sheep

loans.name: Dolores Erlinda

texts.es:
Dolores de 30 años, es una señora muy trabajadora y dedicada a cuidar sus 2 hijos. Actualmente ella vive en la casa de la mamá, junto con sus 2 hermanos. A pesar que ha sufrido la pérdida de su padre recientemente, está tratando de salir adelante y es por eso que solicita la ayuda crediticia.

Dolores Tiene 6 años de estar trabajando con flores y coronas, que las comercializa antes del día de los difuntos, y es de ahí que dependen sus ingresos, además hace pasteles y papas fritas los domingos.

Se le estará ayudando con el préstamo, a doña Dolores, para que pueda comprar la materia prima, para elaborar flores y coronas, así poder ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes y obtener sus ingresos para la familia.

 Su sueño es tener su casa propia, para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 30, is a very hardworking woman dedicated to caring for her two children.  Currently she lives in her mother’s house, together with her two siblings.  In spite of recently suffering the loss of her father, she is trying to get ahead, and it is because of this that she is asking for the help of a loan.

For six years Dolores has worked with flowers and wreaths, which she sells before All Souls’ Day.  Her income depends on this, in addition to making cakes and fried potatoes on Sundays.

The loan will help doña Dolores to be able to buy the raw materials to produce flowers and wreaths and thus be able to offer her products to her customers and earn her income for her family.

Her dream is to have her own house, so that her children might have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make flowers and wreaths.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with four children, 3 of whom attend school and one is still young. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees.

She operates a retail shop business selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
Oscar de 54 años,  debido a la condición económica de sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio, esta acompañado y su compañera de vida  se dedica a vender por las tardes pupusas, para ayudarles en los gastos familiares, han procreado cinco hijos; tres de sus hijos viven en su casa, uno de ellos esta estudiando un noveno grado.


Él se dedica a trabajar como albañil, trabajaba en la agricultura, luego un amigo le dijo que le ayudara como ayudante de albañil en un la construcción de una casa hace 20 años; después de esto le siguió ayudando y aprendiendo en esta actividad, luego se dedico ya por su cuenta. También, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, los trabajos como albañil los realiza dependiendo el lugar donde los solicite y lo hace todo el día, los cultivos agrícolas los realiza cuando tiene el día libre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 2 vacas de ordeño. Con el préstamo, sacara adelante a sus hijos darles el estudio, y espera remodelar su vivienda; ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan mas espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Because of his parents’ economic condition they were unable to provide Oscar, 54, with schooling.  He has a spouse and she works afternoons selling pupusas [filled, grilled corn cakes] to help with household expenses.  They’ve had five children.   Three of their children live at home and one of them is in 9th grade.

He works in construction and in agriculture.  A friend asked him to help him work building a house twenty years ago and he continued helping and learning this activity and then went into it on his own.  He also works in agriculture and raising cattle.  He does the construction work depending on where he’s needed and works all day.  He does his agricultural work when he has a day off.

He’s asking for the loan to buy two dairy cows.  With the loan he’ll be able to provide his children with education and he hopes to remodel his house because his children are growing and they need more space at home.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Edubina

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene una hija mayor de edad y vive en una aldea del municipio de Santa Bárbara. Hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura, produce  café  en pergamino húmedo y los vende en el mercado local de su zona, también  produce bananos y hace viveros de café.  Para mantener produciendo su finca ha tenido que invertir varios préstamos. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, el cual  lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y en el vivero para la siembra de café y  poder ampliar los cultivos. Su plan es  poder tener más cultivos para generar más ingresos y poder tener mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María, 55, is married and has an adult daughter.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Santa Bárbara.

María has worked in agriculture for many years.  She grows wet parchment coffee to sell in the local market in her area.  She also grows banana plants and makes coffee seedlings.  She has had to invest in several loans to keep her farm productive.

María's in her fourth loan cycle and she's requesting 10,000 lempiras [HNL] to invest in fertilizer and coffee seedlings to expand her crops.  Her plan is to have more crops to earn more income and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to grow coffee seedlings

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 50 лет. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Дилором всегда старается для улучшения условия проживания своей семьи.  Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дилором уже давно мечтает организовать свой бизнес и иметь источник дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажи сухофруктов, так как сухофрукты имеют большой спрос на местном рынке. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 50 years old. She is a conscientious and hardworking woman. Dilorom is always trying to improve the living conditions of her family. She is married and is raising three children. Dilorom has long had the dream of starting her own business and having a source of income. 

With this aim, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now, she is fully capable of organizing her own business and becoming successful in this field. She wants to establish a business trading dried fruits, since dried fruits are in high demand in the local market. From the profit, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy goods to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to organize a new business

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 65 years old, married and they have been blessed with two children ages 21 and 29 years old respectively.

He manufactures animal feed and he has been in this business for 5 years. He is borrowing a loan of 100,000 KES which he will use to purchase raw materials for processing animal feed. He plans to increase raw materials with the anticipated profits from the business. This is his 3rd loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for processing animal feed

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 29 años, debido a problemas médicos no puede caminar, pero ello no ha impedido que siga luchando para salir adelante, tal es así que estudia la carrera de ensamblaje de computadoras y ha logrado tener su negocio de cabinas de internet, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para solventar sus terapias y poder crecer cada día a pesar de las adversidades, Miguel cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque su discapacidad no significa que no pueda hacer grandes cosas.

Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindo podrá comprar computadoras par su cabina ya que las que tiene actualmente ya están muy viejitas, así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño: “ Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 29-year-old man who is unable to walk due to medical problems.  But that hasn’t kept him from continuing to strive to get ahead.  So much so that he’s studying computer assembly and also has Internet access booths that he uses to earn income to cover his therapy and be able to grow each day despite adversities.  Miguel believes he does well in his business because he’s kind to his customers and because his disability does not mean he’s incapable of doing great things.

Miguel is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided he will be able to buy computers for his booths because the ones he has now are old.  He’ll be able to offer better customer service this way, to improve his income and to strive to make his dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 63 años vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica una zona que su principal actividad es el comercio y la agricultura a l hora y 30 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo pertenece a la región Lambayeque que se encuentra ubicado en la zona norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, María Mercedes ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de animales de raza mejorando así su negocio y poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 63 years old.  She lives with her husband and her younger son in the district of Nueva Arica, an area whose primary activity is trade and agriculture.  It is 1 hour and 30 minutes from the province of Chiclayo and belongs to the Lambayeque region, which is in the northern part of Peru.

They are a close family who has made their living raising and selling small animals for the past 5 years.  María Mercedes has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevo soles to invest in the purchase of purebred animals, thus improving her business and so that she can offer them to her customers, generating better earnings.

loans.use: to buy purebred animals.

loans.name: Jesus Magdalena

texts.es:
Jesus Magadalena tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera sin carga familiar vive en la casa de su padre en el distrito de Buenos Aires, donde la principal actividad es la crianza y venta de animales menores que pertenece a la provincia de Morropon y se encuentra ubicado a en la Región Piura en la parte norte del Perú.

Ella es una joven emprendedora con buenas referencias personales dentro de la comunidad en donde vive, se dedica desde hace 1 año a la crianza y venta de animales menores, desde Carrasquillo hasta los caseríos aledaños por lo que en la actualidad cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, además de tener ingresos adicionales como trabajadora de limpieza de la posta médica de Salitral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar alimentos balanceados para engorde y crecimiento de sus animales y poder ofrecerlos a mejor precio generándole mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús Magdalena, 23, is single with no dependents.  She lives in her father’s house in Buenos Aires district belonging to Morropon province located in Piura Region in northern Peru where the main activity is raising small animals for sale.

She’s an enterprising young woman with good personal references in the community where she lives.  For the last year she’s been working raising and selling small animals from Carrasquillo to nearby hamlets so she now has regular customers in the zone.  She also earns extra income working as a cleaning lady at the Salitral medical post.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed to fatten them up and grow to be able to sell them at higher prices generating higher profits that way.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima operates an open air food business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she appreciates the previous loan which enabled her to buy ingredients for her food business. In addition, she sells water to supplement her income. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman with no children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

She has operated a clothes selling business where she sells at the market to her fellow town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality and she dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement and a door for her residence.

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari is 45 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 18. 

Many years ago, she established  her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW) and she used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Nanda Kumari plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. 

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventories strong and by purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, it is always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou, âgé de 53 ans, est photographe depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Abdou veut renforcer son activité en achetant un appareil photo numérique, cela lui permettra de gagner plus de marché dans les cérémonies comme les baptêmes, les mariages… Abdou commence sa journée à 9h et  la fini a n’importe quelle heure, temps qu’il y a des cérémonies pour prendre des photos. Si c’est la période creuse, il part dans les studios pour espérer avoir des contacts ou des photos de carte d’identité.
Abdou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
Il veut un jour, ouvrir un studio pour exercer pleinement son activité et créer d’autres activités pour diversifier et maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Abdou, 53, has been a photographer for five years. He is married and a father. Abdou wants to strengthen his business by buying a digital camera. This  will win him more business in ceremonies such as baptisms and weddings. Abdou begins his day at 9AM and finishes at any time, depending on if there are ceremonies to photograph. If it's a peak period, he would start off in the studios for hope of having contacts or photo ID cards.

Abdou is responsible for the daily expenses of the family and the education of his children. He wants to one day open a studio to fully carry out his business and create other businesses to diversify and maximize profit.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 27 years old. She is married to Moses and together they are blessed with three children, two of whom are in schooling.

Lucy has a salon business in Naivasha. She has been running her salon business for two years with an average monthly income of KES 50,000. Lucy has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. This loan will enable her to purchase braids, weaves, etc. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her business.

In the near future, Lucy hopes to see her business grow and she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Lisbhet

texts.es:
Lisbhet es una joven de 20 años la cual trabaja en una pequeña empresa textil en el área de costura, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su manutención, Lisbhet cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cuidadosa.

Lisbhet esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, ripio, hormigón, ladrillos, piedras y poder construir parte de su vivienda, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Lisbhet, 20, is a young woman who works in a small textile firm sewing.  She works about 9 hours daily and uses her earnings to cover her basic needs.  Lisbhet believes she does well in her work because she’s very meticulous.

Lisbhet is grateful to Kiva lenders because she’ll be able to buy building supplies like cement, gravel, concrete, bricks and stone to build part of her house thus improving her quality of life.  She will continue striving to make her dream reality: to finish building her house with substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Logina

texts.en:
Logina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Logina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional material and gear for fishing.

Logina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional material and gear for fishing

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 40 years old and has two children. Marife is married and has two children who are in school.

Marife is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marife requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Marife has been in the business of pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 58 years old and married with three children. 

Veronica is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and bananas in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Veronica has been farming vegetables and bananas for 8 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es estudiante y trabaja a la vez, también comenta que está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad. El comenta que su meta es ser un buen profesional, y que pueda ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Le gusta mucho la carrera que está estudiando, ya que le permitirá abrirse muchas puertas y desarrollarse como persona y profesional, es por eso que está poniendo todo su empeño. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Elías is from the city of Curuguaty.  He’s a student and works at the same time.  He also comments that he’s majoring in Accounting.  He comments that his goal is to become a good professional who can help his family by means of his work.

He likes the career he’s studying very much for it will allow him to open many doors and to develop as a person and a professional; this is why he’s putting his maximum effort into it.  He’s grateful for the opportunity he’s getting for it will be of much help.

He’s asking for this loan to be able to pay university tuition and fees to continue with his studies and striving to become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es: Don Henry de 47 años de edad, habita en Juigalpa Chontales, labora para la Alcaldía de Juigalpa, actualmente esta separado de de su esposa, esta a cargo de su hijo en edad escolar el cual se lo cuida su mama.  Con sacrificio ha ido mejorando las condiciones en su vivienda, cambiando el techo poco a poco, pero no ha logrado cambiarlo en su totalidad, por lo que desea comprar Zing, Perlin, Golosos y pagar mano de obra y así realizar esta inversión de cambiar el Zin en la parte posterior de la Vivienda, el cual esta en mal estado provocando que cuando llueve se moje la parte de adentro de su vivienda.  Con esta mejora estará garantizando  las condiciones habitacional en su hogar.
texts.en: Henry, 47, lives in Juigalpa, Chontales.  He works for Juigalpa city hall.  He’s currently separated from his wife.  Henry’s mother cares for his school-age son.  He’s been improving his home with much sacrifice.  He’s been gradually replacing the roof but hasn’t succeeded in replacing it completely which is why he wants to buy metal sheets, purlins, screws and to pay labor costs to replace the metal sheeting in the rear of the house which is in bad shape and lets rainwater inside that wets the interior of the house.  This improvement will ensure living conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel has a retail business in Makueni town. He sells household goods such as water buckets, jugs and plates. He is 36 years old and is married to Mary. They have one child. Ezekiel has been in the business for 5 years and he makes a monthly income of KES 35,200.

This is his  third loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of household goods to sell. These include plates, cups, water jugs and buckets, cooking pans, stoves and lamps. He anticipates to make more profits, with which he will expand his business and educate his child.

In the future, Ezekiel hopes to own his own business building.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 50 years old, widowed, and mother of four adult children. She has a business of selling cloths in Naivasha, which she has been running for five years. Lucy has applied for her second loan, from Kadet Ltd., to enable her to purchase additional stock of cloths and curtains. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open a boutique.

In the near future, Lucy hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cloths and curtains.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris has a beauty salon business, and has been running it for the last 2 years. She also sells beauty products, and it has been profitable. She is 31 years old and a single mother of one child. 

Having paid all her previous loans successfully, this will be her fourth loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy hair shampoos, towels, hair oils, and nail polish for use in her salon. This will enable her to serve her clients well and generate more profits, with which she will use to educate her child.

In future, Damaris hopes and dreams of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, towels, hair oils, and nail polish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is 23 years old, not yet married but taking care of one child, age 4 years.

She is in the business of beauty salon, which she has been carrying out for the last 3 years. To enable her to buy an extra hair drier to be used on customers who visit her salon, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and she plans to use the profits from her expanded business to buy a blow drier, some hair chemicals, and some weaves.

She hopes that in the future, she will open a hair and beauty college.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier to be used on customers who visit her salon.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single woman with two children; both attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past ten years, Mwanajuma has operated a retail shop business, selling items to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 60 years old and married. She has six children. 

Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Milagros has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past, from NWTF, to sustain her business.

Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 27 years old. He is single and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more retail items such as saucepans, soap and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans, soap and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Rheami

texts.en:
Rheami is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like snack foods, juice, coffee, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. in her general store.

Rheami has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Rheami has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like snack foods, juice, coffee, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman, and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over one year. In addition, she operates a cafe to supplement her income. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business, and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Vita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling food supplements in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Vita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of food supplements to sell to her customers for her business buying and selling food supplements.

Vita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food supplements to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old, married to Evans and together they are blessed with three children aged 20, 18 and 16 years old.

She has a timber business in Naivasha that she has been running for 15 years with an average monthly income of KSH 14,000. She has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase timber for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another timber yard.

In the near future, she hopes her business will grow and her children will be well educated.

loans.use: To purchase timber to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 41 years old, married and together they are blessed with three children who are in school.

She has a charcoal business in Naivasha that she has been running for four years with an average monthly income of KSH 40,000. Josphine has applied for her first loan with Kadet Ltd. to purchase more charcoal for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another charcoal business.

In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a very hardworking lady from Nyahururu. She is 34 years old and married to Peter who produces some additional income for the family. They are blessed with three children who are 14, 12 and 7 years old.

She is into the business of selling fruits and vegetables including tomatoes, fruits and other vegetables, which she has been doing for the past four years.

To enable her to add more stock of these items, she has applied for her first loan of KSHS 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KSHS 16,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to further expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful life and business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, tomatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Mercy, who assists him in farming, and they are blessed with two children, ages 15 and 11 years old.

He is a farmer who practices mixed farming, e.g. growing of crops, such as maize, beans, wheat and potatoes, and keeping livestock, such as cows and goats. He has been in this business for the last five years. 

To enable him be more productive, he has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Kadet Ltd., which shall be used to buy a heifer and pay laborers who work in his farm.

His monthly income right now is KES 20,000, and he hopes to use the profits from his expanded business to pay his loan to Kadet Ltd. and educate his children.

In the future, charles hopes to buy a piece of land on which he will specialize in modern dairy farming

loans.use: to buy a heifer and pay laborers working in his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old, married to Tecla and they have been blessed with two children (aged 10 and 14 years). Joseph is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for four years with a current monthly income of KES 20,000.

Joseph is borrowing KES 50,000 in order  to expand his business. He plans to increase his animal stock with the anticipated profit. This is his second loan, after successfully paying back his previous loan.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old. He is a father of four children, between nine and sixteen years of age. 

With the loan, Joseph would like to buy more flour and cups as well as plates to be used in his mini restaurant. He has spent two years in his business. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more flour for using in the bakery, cups and plates for use in the business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan es un hombre emprendedor y dinámico que decidió hace algunos años iniciar su propio negocio, idea que surgió de la necesidad de generar los recursos económicos por cuenta propia, pues se le hacía difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo por la alta demanda que existe en el país. Por esta razón montó un pequeño almacén de accesorios para celulares y alquiler de películas, trabaja solo todos los días de la semana, de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm y ofrece accesorios de celulares, recargas, cargadores, presta el servicio de reparación y además alquila películas en DVD, de esta manera obtiene el dinero suficiente para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Juan aprendió la actividad de un familiar que le enseñó a desenvolverse en el campo de los negocios, especialmente de telefonía móvil. Su negocio ha dado buenos resultados y poco a poco ha ido aumentando sus ventas, esto lo motiva a seguir buscando alternativas para seguir avanzando, por ello, solicita el séptimo ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar una vitrina de exhibición y mercancía al por mayor (equipos móviles, películas, recargas, protectores de pantalla, carcasas, entre otros), de esta manera tendrá la posibilidad de mostrar mejor los productos que ofrece y además tendrá un inventario más variado para satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes, lo que se reflejará en el incremento notable de las ventas y los ingresos generados por estas. Juan con su espíritu luchador y su entusiasmo desea seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y sueña con adquirir un local mucho más grande para ampliar su negocio y combinarlo con una sala de internet, así prestará un servicio integrado y en un mismo lugar, logrando atraer más clientes y mejorando la entrada de recursos económicos con los que podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan’s an enterprising, dynamic man who decided a few years ago to open his own business.  The idea arose from the need to generate income of his own for he was finding it difficult to find employment because of the high demand for jobs in the country.  Because of this, he opened a small store where he sells mobile phone accessories and rents movies.  He works alone every day of the week from 8am until 7pm.  He sells mobile phone accessories, air time recharges, chargers and also provides repair services.  He also rents movie DVDs earning enough money this way to contribute to household support.

Juan learned the activity from a family member who taught him how to manage in business especially in the mobile phone area.  His business has had good results and his sales have gradually increased.  This motivates him to continue seeking alternatives to continue making progress.

This is why he’s requesting his 7th loan that he will use to buy a display case and merchandise at wholesale (mobile phones, movies, chargers, screen protectors, cases, etc.) in order to better display his goods and to have a more varied inventory of products on-hand to satisfy his customers’ needs and wants which will lead to a significant increase in sales and in income generated by them.

With his warrior spirit and enthusiasm, Juan intends to continue strengthening his small business and dreams with acquiring a larger locale to expand the business and combine it with an Internet café to provide an integrated service in the same place succeeding in attracting more customers improving his income to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina works hard to support her family. Melodina is married, and she has a business making furniture in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paint, paint brushes, nails, etc., for her business.

Melodina has been in this business for 20 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paint, paint brushes, nails, etc., for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is widowed and has five young children who go to school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, Halima has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase fabric and threads for her sewing business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida operates a kiosk, selling bread, sweets, biscuits, etc. She earns additional income selling charcoal. 

Faida is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to to purchase biscuits, bread, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil for her business.  With the loan, she hopes to improve her business. Faida feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which has allowed her to maintain her level of profits and help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ricaute De Jesús

texts.es: Ricaute es un padre de familia que desde hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de fundición de metales como cobre y aluminio, actividad que realiza desde su propio taller ubicado en el occidente de la ciudad donde reside y donde se ha dado a conocer realizando su labor. De esta forma ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos, por los cuales lucha incansablemente para darles una buena educación y bienestar.  Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar un molino de metales, con el que podrá reducir  los costos de producción, ya que él mismo podrá moler el cobre y el aluminio para luego fundirlo y no tendrá que seguir pagando por este servicio, además mejorará las condiciones de trabajo; así mejorará notablemente la entrada de recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades de su familia y podrá seguir avanzando para llegar a cumplir su mayor deseo que es acreditar bien su negocio y adquirir más molinos para poder aumentar la producción.  De esta forma Ricaute tendrá la oportunidad de generar una estabilidad económica favorable, que según él, es indispensable para que las cosas del hogar funcionen correctamente, logrando que sus hijos tengan una excelente educación, un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricaute’s a father who has worked for several years smelting metals like copper and aluminum.  He does this in his own workshop located in the western part of the city where he lives and where he’s become well-known doing this work.  He’s managed to support his family consisting of his wife and three children this way.  He strives for them unceasingly to provide them with a good education and well-being.

He’s asking for this loan at present to buy a metal grinder to reduce his production costs because he will be able to grind the copper and aluminum himself to then smelt it; he will no longer have to pay for this service and he will also improve his working conditions thus significantly improving his income to meet family needs and continue making progress to reach his greatest dream which is to prove his business’ worth and to acquire more mills to be able to increase production.  In this way, Ricaute will be able to generate favorable economic stability which, according to him, is indispensable so that things at home will function correctly succeeding in providing an excellent education for his children, improved well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a metal grinder.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 44 years old and married. She has been blessed with four children, aged 23, 20,18 and 12 years. She is a tailor, and she has been in business for 14 years. Right now, her monthly income from the business is KES 25,000.  She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use it to purchase materials to make sofa cushion covers, commonly referred to as "vitambas."

Jeniffer plans to pay back her loan with the anticipated revenues. This is her second loan. Her hope and dream is to expand her business and to create employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make sofa cushion covers

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un des villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. KARIA MPERE 1ere femme  à debout à  droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  un sac de 100kgs  des graines d’arachide et 100kgs de mil. Elles s’approvisionnent KROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU et KIMPARANA pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are on average 34 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kouroubadougou,  which is one of the villages in the San circle of the fourth administrative region of Mali.
These women met through family ties and do business in the buying and selling of seeds.
Having correctly repaid their previous seasonal loans, the women of the Tiessiri group request their first solidarity loan. Karia Mpere, who is the first woman standing on the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy a bag of 100 kilograms of groundnut seeds and 100 kilograms of millet. They buy their supplies in Kroubadougou and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods at Kouroubadougou and Kimparana on market days to a clientele made up of both men and women for cash and often for credit.
They plan to make an average monthly profit of 15 000FCFA which they will use for expenses relative to health, food, clothing and school fees and the remainder will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase millet and groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 50 years old and has a live-in partner. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juliet has a vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

Juliet has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Juliet would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gritta

texts.en:
Gritta is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, aged between five and eight. She has been selling locally made beer from sorghum for the past three years. 

With the loan, Gritta would like to buy more sorghum to make more locally produced beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for making local beers.

loans.name: Gerondia

texts.en:
Gerondia works hard to support her family. Gerondia is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, laundry soap, coffee, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell.

Gerondia has been in this business for 10 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like shampoo, laundry soap, coffee, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KOUROUBADOUGOU un des villages dans le cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines.
 Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents en prêt de campagne,  les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur 1 er   prêt solidaire. ROUTHE 1ere femme  à gauche   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  un sac de 100kgs  des graines d’arachide et 100kgs de mil. Elles s’approvisionnent KOUROUBADOUGOU et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KOUROUBADOUGOU et KIMPARANA pendant les jours de foires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
