Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra repuestos para realizar la reparación de su motocicleta y poder transportase a su trabajo de la mejor manera y más eficiente. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores repuestos y de buena calidad para que su motocicleta no le dé desperfectos a corto plazo y así poder cumplir con su trabajo de una forma más adecuada y eficiente. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ignacio is 34 years old and single, He lives with his parents and siblings and they are his main priority. Ignacio plans to buy replacement parts to fix his motorcycle and be able to transport himself at work in the best, most efficient manner. He wants to buy the best, top quality parts so he doesn't have problems with his bike in the short term. Then he can carry-out his work in an adequate and efficient manner. His is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the state banks. The loan from FUDECOSUR offers better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elilibeth

texts.en: Elilibeth is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for nine years, and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Levi

texts.en: Levi is a 42-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Levi needs a loan to buy coolers, cordials, sugar and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to save for her child's education. Levi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy coolers, cordials, sugar and foam cups

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Hour is 54 years old, married, and the mother of four children, living in a rural village of the Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. 

She earns a living by working in the construction site alongside her husband, who is a master builder. Together, they can earn a wage of US$ 11 per day, which she usually uses for meals, commodities costs and allowances for her children.

Hour doesn't own a motorcycle for commuting, so she has applied for a loan of US$ 800 from HKL to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill their needs. This purchase will enable them to reduce some expenses on transportation service and go to work on time. 

In the future, Hour aims to save enough to start up a hog-raising business to make additional income to satisfy her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional spices like onions, garlic, ginger, etc. to sell to her customers. Nenita has been in this business for 20 years, and supplements her income by providing motorcycle transportation and farming rice. She has sustained her business activities through her own hard work and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spices like onions, garlic, ginger, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jorge Eliécer

texts.es: Jorge es un emprendedor de 29 años de edad, con un espíritu de superación que lo ha llevado a iniciar su propio negocio, en vista de no conseguir oportunidades de empleo. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, recorre varios municipios del oriente antioqueño vendiendo mercancía a crédito, de manera ambulante, su transporte es una bicicleta adaptada como carreta para poder llevar los productos que ofrece y, de esta forma ha generado los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (armarios, ventiladores, juegos de sábanas, ollas y otros artículos para el hogar), pues así podrá abastecerse para la temporada de fin de año, disminuyendo los costos, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en el margen de ganancia que obtiene por las ventas. Jorge manifiesta que su único desafío es manejar la cartera, pero hasta el momento la ha sabido controlar y todos los clientes han pagado cumplidamente; además sueña con seguir trabajando arduamente y en un futuro pueda tener la oportunidad de montar su propia distribuidora de mercancía, mejorando así la calidad de vida y su bienestar.
texts.en: Jorge is a 29 year old entrepreneur with a can-do spirit that has led him to start his own business when he was not able to find gainful employment. He currently works as an independent merchant, traveling through various municipalities of eastern Antioquia selling merchandise door-to-door on credit. His mode of transportation is a bicycle adapted as a wagon so that he is able to carry the products that he offers. In this way, he has been able to generate sufficient income to take care of his household. With the loan he currently seeks, Jorge will build his business by purchasing wholesale merchandise (cabinets, fans, sheets, pots and pans, and other household items) in preparation for the end of the year sales season. This will reduce costs, which will then increase the profit margin from his sales. Jorge states that his only challenge is managing his portfolio, but to date he has been able to manage it and all of his customers have paid on time. Furthermore, he hopes to continue working hard and to one day open his own distribution business, thereby improving his well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale merchandise (cabinets, fans, sheets, pots and pans, and other household items).

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As the married parent of eight children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising pigs. 

Shirley is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish business.

Shirley has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 19 years old and single, with no children. 

She makes and sells rice and curry in Malie Primary School and in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Lise needs a loan to buy chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, seasoning oil, foil, and foam plates. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. 

Lise has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy chicken, curry powder, garlic, onions, seasoning oil, foil, and foam plates
